documents.document: @CateOwen Agree! And that boys are made to wear shorts in the winter. I protested against both many decades ago when I was at school.
Love this. Reminds me of the Afghan security guard who concluded I was trying to be a good Muslim after glimpsing m… https://t.co/vl50vi0ykL
I feel awe at the fact my colleagues at @pchrgaza have been fighting every day for 30 years. They #resist #persist & they laugh a lot xxx
Nobody knows importance of remembering what we love & finding humour in everything better than my Palestinian colleagues. We learn from them
@DearMama_ Working in the 'world is on fire' sector for 25 yrs, I say humour is a crucial ingredient for longevity. Gazan's taught me that.
Really important work from @Jess_McAllen https://t.co/ol2dJLHJRH
I just pledged a bed to host a family seeking refuge in New Zealand. You should too! https://t.co/OY3HMP4BbD via @actionstation
Here are five things you can do for refugees today (and yes, @DearMama_ your sweet boy can pledge a bed) https://t.co/ntCyhVMGKr
@JAMacBrayne We're setting up an online form to make it even easier!
@karlwkane @pmbillenglish Dunne strong on refugees for long time. David Seymour supported incr quota too. National failed to lead on this.
I wish we didn't need to legislate for human decency, but we often do and this one seems unarguable. Great work Nic… https://t.co/TRlYe4PZhK
Some days Peter Dunne is the person who says what I'm thinking. Not every day, to be sure, but some days, yes. https://t.co/ka5llApBIk
This only takes a few mins. Govt made smallest possible increase to our refugee intake last year, w/ enough public… https://t.co/cE9a2KXOKO
@MiramarMike @MaryFisherNZ We all unwind in different ways. I donit by running. Good for those of us who are extra tightly wound...
@scoutriver Or my least fav: 'Speak for those who cannot' Really? I think you'll find they can if we shut up & listen
On a brighter note, this is why I've been running so much: I'm one of the guides running an ultra with @MaryFisherNZ https://t.co/WQUzrhW0WZ
@grantrobertson1 I'm sorry you have to deal with that. I often think of what all our MPs must put up with, some of you more than others.
“An open letter to my non-political friends” Great piece by my colleague @laura_oc_rapira https://t.co/55gX7LX5fA https://t.co/mXxf7gnOSs
Time for @pmbillenglish to state where NZ stands on #Muslimban and to #doublethequota of refugees. if we're silent, we're complicit
@Allienz78 @actionstation Yes, I felt very much the same way
@SophieFern Oh. Wow. I'm having a wee cry myself now.
"Battles are ugly when women fight", but they're beautiful otherwise? Re-reading books of my childhood to see where… https://t.co/H78pKlolCh
@AmandaFarough Bless you. He's fairly robust but currently has a lung infection so not quite fighting fit 💕
Which may mean he's not up for punching Nazis, but maybe the over 70's get a pass on that? https://t.co/f463P9vaPX
Dad's on his way to D.C. for work on prison reform, as we finished my pre-departure briefing he said 'I'm planning not to fight people Mari'
@gemmagracewood Also, Dad is right now boarding a flight to D.C. So he'll wave to you and Mu as he flies over, but he's keen to meet Mu soon
@gemmagracewood @REasther @MattNippert @dubpies As long as you have said baby! Was just talking to Dad about how anticipated your visit is
@LI_politico I know. I've felt bad about prioritizing my ease & sense of safety over rights of others, so today I matched action w my values
@LI_politico Ashamed to say that hat today was the day I deleted my Uber account. Should have happened much sooner. Better late than never?
@sacraparental @DoingOurBitNZ Good question. Basically use this moment to bring more NZers to support doubling the quota, esp more voters
Much love to Muslims & everyone standing with them in the US. And for immigration lawyers working to protect their clients & constitution.
@ranginui OMG that's beautiful
@devinecelt No, you are right. I didn't say all women and don't assume all women. Certainly don't claim to speak for anyone by myself.
@krausekm1 And no question about my whiteness or my privilege, no argument there.
@krausekm1 Fair point. I don't claim to speak for anyone but myself, and don't mean all women want this conversation, but some do.
It's not a great piece of writing, but it's a topic lots of women want to read/talk about. And that's heartening, for me.
More than 25k ppl read my piece on race, feminism & #womensmarch Taking it as a sign, women want this conversation: https://t.co/yO09HISYIb
@MattNippert @dubpies @gemmagracewood If you need something done, ask busiest people you know. It may be killing all 4 of us, but it works.
I'm putting this up on my wall to help me laugh at, & thereby survive, the creatures of the comments. Thanks @XTOTL https://t.co/mC8db2XuOH
@MattNippert Maybe someone at @dubpies could do that? Or @gemmagracewood might know someone who gets the paper
@RichieHardcore Me too. Unhealthy, and addictive. I thought it would be easy to change that habit, but forced cold turkey is the only way!
I've been slow on this. An uncle in pain changed that. So @actionstation finally has a campaign on medical marijuana https://t.co/bodo702TtG
@RichieHardcore Well, I'm usually hopeless at that. But having no phone and no internet at home helps with boundaries :-)
Killed my phone. No internet at home. If you need me, email or DM on Twitter & I'll respond in work hours https://t.co/RvkNRhLIg4 via @giphy
@VenusThrash Yes, many wise people, esp POC, have been saying this for years. I'm not saying anything new, but hopefully to some new people.
@LizzieMarvelly That's so low, but your response is amazing.
@DebsHancock It's great! Both practical & strategic. Will look up that next.
@caniwikiwi @womensart1 That is beautiful
@jenthinksharder Wow, that's lovely (& uncomfortable because I'm a Kiwi and I learned to deflect kindness, but I'm learning not to, thanks)
@Tamatoa_Mata Thank you!
@wirehuntphoto Suggested reading: https://t.co/um5F7GjSZE
Quick word Pākehā folks: We have a lot of jobs when it comes to race relations in our country. And judging tikanga… https://t.co/Oip5yh65S8
@whaeapower Words is my thang. You do many other things better x
@whaeapower What you have been saying. What lots of people have been saying. xx
@kaupapa We have a long-term strategy for building a movement. A strategy for each core campaign, and this year, a strategy for the election
Whether your work is ending poverty or climate change, racism is at the heart of the challenge you're tackling: https://t.co/gwkCGnoEl8
Finished paper to ActionStation Board proposing our strategy for 2017. Resisted temptation to just write out all of #rulesforrevolutionaries
@LizzieMarvelly Ergh, I heard that on the radio too. So wrong. "This is the real tikanga, the kind that doesn't make me uncomfortable."
@scoutriver What you wrote was fair & loving & needed to be said. If people need to talk about their hurt feelings send them to me.
@LI_politico 'If they can knit hats on down-low, what else might they be planning?' 'Think we should start listening when they talk?' 'Nah'
The Australian politician getting qus implying that not being a mother disqualifies her for office remind me how the world still sees me.
@sataylish Thank you!
I'd rather stay & keep writing about feminism, race, power, solidarity & protest. But I have housework to do. Some kind of irony in that...
@nzdodo @LI_politico First thoughts here (more to come) https://t.co/tnuStQwYTJ
I just published “Why the Women’s March made me think about racism.” https://t.co/5CCDrwLZ87
@LI_politico @nzdodo But my FB/ Insta feeds full of friends in US out for the first time. I hope this is a beginning for them, of waking up
@LI_politico @nzdodo I'm planning to write about this today. I loved the Wellly march & am glad I went. Most ppl I saw are out often...
Also, those cute pics of police wearing pink pussy hats? They'd be easier to enjoy after police have worn Black Liv… https://t.co/B9di56U68u
@nzdodo it's a tactic that would work, prob (and sometimes how allies can help) & at same time we tackle the racism that causes this head on
Before you celebrate how gently the police handled Women's March's all over the world, this is a fact worth reflect… https://t.co/4aI4R2DTBX
@styler That's not an excuse, but an honest reflection. On a good day, I'm all 'bring on yr honest feedback' On a bad day I feel under siege
@styler I really do try but when trolls are baying for my blood, it can be hard to see the friends gently pointing out where I'm going wrong
Yesterday we marched. Today she came over to help me move heavy furniture. The force is strong in this one 💪🏻 https://t.co/idMdbhVj7c
@Trabaq Thank you!
Oh this one made me well up ❤️ https://t.co/gnFNIlNvpR
TFW a movement you helped found gets a mention in what may be the new bible for folks who want to change the world… https://t.co/6Cof6IDVzt
@yogaboho @lightyouonfire @whaeapower When a kids asks me 'Why are they angry?' w/ curiosity & not fear I figure the balance is being struck
@yogaboho @lightyouonfire @whaeapower Also most kids know & understand the anger of injustice & abuse of power. They can relate to that...
@yogaboho @lightyouonfire @whaeapower Yes and there's a kind of processed, focused anger which is v different in energy & impact to raw rage
@yogaboho @lightyouonfire @whaeapower The kids I was with kept trying to spot Trump in the crowd. 'Is that him?' Who's scaring who then? 🙀
@lightyouonfire @yogaboho @whaeapower I think there's space for anger & disruption that isn't scary for kids. Interesting challenge!
@Becs @whaeapower @yogaboho Also, That sucks.
@Becs @whaeapower @yogaboho All these events are what the lucky few can do, but when we do it well (and follow up) we do it for all of us xx
@whaeapower @yogaboho s/o asked if I had shouted it, but I was busy answering a 7yr old's qus, incl 'Is (the Beehive) Donald Trump's house?'
@whaeapower @yogaboho Opps, obviously they shouted 'Stop being so nice' not 'bring'
@whaeapower @yogaboho Someone shouted 'Stop bring so nice!' at the Wellington march. I suspect the wonderful Gaylene Preston 💪🏻
@yogaboho Me too. I've always believed in power & appropriateness of anger, but now I see my own privilege & desire to appease more clearly.
Great thread. Worth reading if you have reckons on: - anger being a problem; or - 'respectful' activism more effe… https://t.co/cZGLM7cyGp
@hjlownsbrough @zackexley We're pretty excited about it here. Reorienting ActionStation strategy, staff & skills accordingly!
Soundtrack. Sisters. Signs. Sisters. #lettherevolutionbegin https://t.co/qBXlmWuC4b
At the station waiting on my women & indulging in the fantasy that everyone coming off every train is here to march #WomensMarchOnWashington
"We will be heard. We will organize. We are energized. We are powerful." Real people power is held collectively f… https://t.co/2Bif50p1p7
@oiselle Oh how I love you 😍 - a revolutionary, feminist philosophy and gorgeous, wearable designs. Thank you @oiselle_sally 💪🏻🏃🏻‍♀️❤️
We all have our forms of revolutionary action. This morning mine was 'Reading in bed' #rulesforrevolutionaries Than… https://t.co/JNsenYaiUN
Coffee fortune on point today. I'd add 'Stand in and with and up for the light' On that note, I'm off to the Women… https://t.co/ftbIz2mFmW
@revhirini Yes, all of that and a renewed passion for supporting the really good investigative journalists we have left.
@moanatribe @BoquitaNZ Oh yeah, I remember all the meat there! But also the music, the dance
@lilith_grace Thinking of you. Sending love.
@stellduffy With you sister x
@josiecampbell Excellent impulse! Thanks to @gemmagracewood I saw her in Brooklyn last year and it was everything. It was perfect.
